required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA and 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA for Identification and Treatment of PSMA-expressing Metastatic Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer (SECuRE)
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase I/IIa Theranostic Study of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA and 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA for Identification and Treatment of PSMA-expressing Metastatic Castrate Resistant Prostate Cancer

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of this study is to determine the safety and efficacy of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA in participants with PSMA-expressing metastatic castrate resistant prostate cancer.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: This study is to be conducted in 3 phases, a dosimetry phase, a dose escalation phase and a cohort expansion phase.

primary_outcome.description: Biodistribution will be calculated by utilizing the PET/CT scans.
Dosimetry will be calculated by utilizing the PET/CT scans.

primary_outcome.measure: Modelling of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA dosimetry utilizing the 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA PET/CT scans
primary_outcome.description: Dosimetry will be calculated by utilizing the PET/CT scans.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximum Tolerated Dose or Maximum Feasible Dose of a single dose of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA
primary_outcome.description: MDT as determined by cohort observations of DLTs

primary_outcome.measure: Recommended dose of two doses of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA
primary_outcome.description: Recommended dose as determined by cohort observations of DLTs

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA in terms of PSA response
primary_outcome.description: Proportion of participants with ≥50% decline in PSA

primary_outcome.measure: Efficacy of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA in terms of radiographic response
primary_outcome.description: Efficacy will be assessed via the overall response rate according to RECIST V1.1 for soft tissue disease and according PCWG3 for bone lesions

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.description: Adverse Events will be as assessed by CTCAE version 5.00

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA: Number of Participants With Changes from baseline in Vital Signs
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in vital signs

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA: Number of Participants With Changes from baseline in ECG parameters
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in ECG parameters

primary_outcome.measure: Safety and tolerability of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA: Number of Participants With Changes from baseline in laboratory results
primary_outcome.description: Change from baseline in laboratory results

primary_outcome.measure: Incidence of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA Treatment-Emergent Adverse Events [Safety and Tolerability]
primary_outcome.description: Adverse Events will be as assessed by CTCAE version 5.00

arm_group.description: In the dosimetry phase patients will receive a single 200 MBq administration of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA. In the dose escalation phase patients will receive up to 2 administrations of 200 MBq of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA. In the cohort expansion phase patients will receive up to 3 administrations of 200 MBq of 64Cu-SAR-bisPSMA. In the dose escalation phase patients will receive up to 2 administrations of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA (dose will be determined based on cohort allocation). In the cohort expansion phase patients will receive 2 administrations of 67Cu-SAR-bisPSMA at the recommended dose level determined through dose escalation.

facility.name: Tulane Cancer Center, Tulane Medical School
Washington University School of Medicine at Barnes-Jewish Hospital
Weill Cornell Medicine at New York-Presbyterian
